text:
Free food at the new Verts, a fast-casual Mediterranean eatery Updated: February 22, 2017 — 1:35 AM EST 1 Share Michael Klein, editor/producer of Philly.com/food, has written about Philadelphia’s restaurant scene since 1993 in his Inquirer column, “Table Talk,” and on his Philly.com blog, “The Insider.” 
Center City is about to get Verts Mediterranean Grill 
Free food (one full-size entree per person) will be offered from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. opening day — Friday, March 10 — 
The first 100 guests that day will receive swag bags including recipe cards, water bottles, koozies, and sunglasses. 
Founders Michael Heyne and Dominik Stein, both raised in Germany and studying business at the University of Texas at Austin, started the company in 2011 and based the menu on the doner kebab, the Turkish variation of the rotisserie meat also known as shawarma and gyros.
